sect1.title: HASH32
sect1.para: The HASH32 function returns a 32-bit FNV (Fowler/Noll/Vo) hash value derived from all the values in the expressionlist. This uses a hashing algorithm that is faster and less likely than HASH to return the same values from different data. Trailing spaces are trimmed from string (or UNICODE) fields before the value is calculated (casting to DATA prevents this).
See Also: DISTRIBUTE, HASH, HASH64, HASHCRC, HASHMD5
